item.title: Julie add a quote by Joseph R. Cooke
item.description: "Grace is the face that love wears when it meets imperfection." -- Joseph R. Cooke

item.title: Julie add a quote by Os Guiness
item.description: "Christianity is the only religion whose God bears the scars of evil." -- Os Guiness

item.title: Julie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and Iâ€” I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Julie add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "Behind the corpse in the reservoir, behind the ghost on the links, Behind the lady who dances and the man who madly drinks, Under the look of fatigue, the attack of migraine and the sigh There is always another story, there is more than meets the eye." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Julie add a quote by Michelangelo
item.description: "So now, from this mad passion Which made me take art for an idol and a king I have learnt the burden of error that it bore And what misfortune springs from man's desire... The world's frivolities have robbed me of the time That I was given for reflecting upon God." -- Michelangelo

item.title: Julie add a quote by St. Ignatius of Loyola
item.description: "God freely created us so that we might know, love, and serve him in this life and be happy with him forever. God's purpose in creating us is to draw forth from us a response of love and service here on earth, so that we may attain our goal of everlasting happiness with him in heaven. All the things in this world are gifts of God, created for us, to be the means by which we can come to know him better, love him more surely, and serve him more faithfully. As a result, we ought to appreciate and use these gifts of God insofar as they help us toward our goal of loving service and union with God. But insofar as any created things hinder our progress toward our goal, we ought to let them go." -- St. Ignatius of Loyola

item.title: Julie add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "To believe in the supernatural is not simply to believe that after living a successful, material, and fairly virtuous life here one will continue to exist in the best-possible substitute for this world, or that after living a starved and stunted life here one will be compensated with all the good things one has gone without: it is to believe that the supernatural is the greatest reality here and now." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Julie add a quote by Eugene Ionesco
item.description: "In the history of humanity there are no civilizations or cultures which fail to manifest, in one or a thousand ways, this need for an absolute that is called heaven, freedom, a miracle, a lost paradise to be regained, peace, the going beyond History... There is no religion in which everyday life is not considered a prison; there is no philosophy or ideology that does not think that we live in alienation.... Humanity has always had a nostalgia for the freedom that is only beauty, that is only real; life, plenitude, light." -- Eugene Ionesco

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is when we notice the dirt that God is most present in us; it is the very sign of His presence." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Evil is unspectacular and always human, And shares our bed and eats at our own table ...." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Julie add a quote by Simone Weil
item.description: "Imaginary evil is romantic and varied; real evil is gloomy, monotonous, barren, boring. Imaginary good is boring; real good is always new, marvelous, intoxicating." -- Simone Weil

item.title: Julie add a quote by Pierre Teilhard De Chardin
item.description: "Do not forget that the value and interest of life is not so much to do conspicuous things...as to do ordinary things with the perception of their enormous value." -- Pierre Teilhard De Chardin

item.title: Julie add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "For three things I thank God every day of my life: thanks that he has vouchsafed me knowledge of his works; deep thanks that he has set in my darkness the lamp of faith; deep, deepest thanks that I have another life to look forward to--a life joyous with light and flowers and heavenly song." -- Helen Keller
